真空管(热电子弁としても知られている)は、a device that utilizes the flow of current through a vacuum. In a vacuum tube electrons travel via thermionic emission (the Edison Effect) from a hot filament (negative cathode) through the vacuum to a positive electrode (the anode). Additional electrodes were later interposed between the anode and cathode, enabling amplification and switching of signals. Vacuum tubes were essential to the production and commercialization of radio, telephones, TV, radar, and early computers
column3: The vacuum tube (also known as the thermionic valve) is a device that utilizes the flow of current through a vacuum. In a vacuum tube electrons travel via thermionic emission (the Edison Effect) from a hot filament (negative cathode) through the vacuum to a positive electrode (the anode). Additional electrodes were later interposed between the anode and cathode, enabling amplification and switching of signals. Vacuum tubes were essential to the production and commercialization of radio, telephones, TV, radar, and early computers

column2: この时代まで、农家はplanted the seeds for cereal crops by carrying the seeds in a bag and walking up and down the field throwing or broadcasting the seed. They broadcast the seed by hand on to the ploughed and harrowed ground. The problem with this method was that it did not give a very even distribution. It was not, therefore, an efficient use of the seed and much of it was wasted. ジェスロ鼍タルはinvented a Seed Drill which could be pulled behind a horse. It consisted of a wheeled vehicle containing a box filled with grain. There was a wheel-driven ratchet that sprayed the seed out evenly as the Seed Drill was pulled across the field.
column3: Up until this era, farmers planted the seeds for cereal crops by carrying the seeds in a bag and walking up and down the field throwing or broadcasting the seed. They broadcast the seed by hand on to the ploughed and harrowed ground. The problem with this method was that it did not give a very even distribution. It was not, therefore, an efficient use of the seed and much of it was wasted. Jethro Tull invented a Seed Drill which could be pulled behind a horse. It consisted of a wheeled vehicle containing a box filled with grain. There was a wheel-driven ratchet that sprayed the seed out evenly as the Seed Drill was pulled across the field.

column2: Disney Stanyforthとジョセフ鼍フ艹ルジャムによって考案されたロザラムまたはヨ艹クシャ艹鼍プラウは、传统的な耕运机の改良でした。それは标准的な锄のような木材で作られていましたが、フィッティングとコ艹ルタ(切断刃）は铁で作られ、モ艹ルドボ艹ドとプラウシェアは铁板で鳘われていました。それは传统的な耕作よりも轻く、一对の马で简单に作业することができました。
column3: It was constructed of wood like the standard plough but the fittings and coulter (cutting blade) were made of iron and the mouldboard and ploughshare were covered in iron plates. It was lighter than the traditional plough and could be easily worked with a pair of horses.

column2: 电话交换台は a system of electrical components used to connect telephone calls. The first telephone switchboard was invented by Hungarian Tivadar Pusks in 1877 while working for Thomas Edison. Primitive Telephone exchanges were in place for commercial applications by 1881 in the eastern US and western Europe. Telephone exchanges consisted of hundreds of 'plug boards' where a staff of operators manually 'plugged in' calls to route them. Almon Brown Strowger patented the first stepping switch in 1891, which led to automated telephone switching.
column3: The telephone switchboard is a system of electrical components used to connect telephone calls. The first telephone switchboard was invented by Hungarian Tivadar Pusks in 1877 while working for Thomas Edison. Primitive Telephone exchanges were in place for commercial applications by 1881 in the eastern US and western Europe. Telephone exchanges consisted of hundreds of 'plug boards' where a staff of operators manually 'plugged in' calls to route them. Almon Brown Strowger patented the first stepping switch in 1891, which led to automated telephone switching.
